page.title: 11LOCAL FARMING
page.content: FARMING_Nearly all the land lying to the east of Halesfield Industrial Estate for 1 mile to the B4379 road is agricultural land. FARMING CATEGORIES_These fall into two main categories, these being arable and pasture land.Crops grown include barley,wheat,oats and root crops such as sugar beet and potatoes. LANDSCAPE_The land in this area can be seen to be gently undulating with no sharp contrast of land cover.Fields are surrounded by hedges and fences. In areas of uncultivated land there small wooded clumps of deciduous trees and shrubs. MACHINERY AND EMPLOYMENT_The type of farming in this area is intensive in terms of machinery. This is used at every stage of cultivation.Men are employed as tractor drivers or cow herdsmen.
